intro: Plagiobothrys piperi, commonly known as the Sierra foothill lily, is a perennial herb native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often found in the Sierra Nevada foothills. Its flowers are small, white to pale blue, and bloom in early spring. Plagiobothrys piperi is known for its delicate appearance and is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution.
